frameDefinitions: An Agent intends and takes steps towards bringing about a State_of_affairs or, metonymically, towards acquiring a Sought_entity .
In this frame an Experiencer experiences an Emotion or is in an Emotional_state.
The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
An Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a Stimulus.
frameExamples: My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
The children <t>enjoyed</t> noise games and sing-songs.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to  obtain a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to acquire.
A state or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to bring about. The Agent may but need not be a participant in that <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> is seeking to achieve a particular <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to acquire a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Emotion</fen> or is in the <fen>Emotional_state</fen>.
The <fen>Emotion</fen> is the feeling that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences.
The <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is the state the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in.
The <fen>Evaluation</fen> is a negative or positive assessment of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> regarding his or her <fen>Emotional_state</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
listRoleExamples:
<fex>Those states</fex> sought a remedy that would substantially change the company's business
practices.
Or the monstrous Saddam, who filled mass graves to bursting, invaded two neighboring countries, and avidly sought <fex>weapons of mass destruction</fex>.
His enemies sought <fex>his destruction</fex>.
The disclosure came as prosecutors successfully sought <fex>in federal court</fex> to keep Luise Garofalo behind bars.
After two pints, <fex>he</fex> felt a bit better and Ted arrived.
Patients experience <fex>high anxiety levels</fex> at time of admission to hospital.
Her heart was galloping so fast that she felt <fex>quite giddy with happiness</fex>.
Max was feeling <fex>worse than he'd ever felt in his life</fex>.
Everyone loves <fex>compliments</fex>.
Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
Katrina tested <fex>her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
